2.  <a href="/presets/sortable" class="decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100 no-underline hover:underline text-xs tracking-wide font-semibold uppercase flex items-center gap-1.5 contrast-more:underline contrast-more:decoration-current">Sortable</a>

# useSortable

</div>

<div class="grid [&>*+*]:mt-5 whitespace-pre-wrap">

The `useSortable` hook is an abstraction that composes the <a href="/api-documentation/droppable" class="underline decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100"><code class="sourceCode mandoc">useDroppable</code></a> and <a href="/api-documentation/draggable" class="underline decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100"><code class="sourceCode mandoc">useDraggable</code></a> hooks.

<div class="mx-auto page-width-wide:mx-0 w-full decoration-primary/6 print:break-inside-avoid max-w-3xl page-width-wide:max-w-full page-api-block:ml-0 flex flex-row gap-3 justify-center">

<div class="relative overflow-hidden">

<div class="relative overflow-hidden after:block after:absolute after:-inset-0 after:pointer-events-none w-fit">

</div>

</div>

<div class="hint transition-colors rounded-md straight-corners:rounded-none circular-corners:rounded-xl overflow-hidden bg-info border-info theme-muted-tint:bg-info-solid/2 [html.sidebar-filled.theme-bold.tint_&]:bg-info-solid/2 text-sm grid grid-cols-[auto_1fr] mx-auto page-width-wide:mx-0 w-full decoration-primary/6 print:break-inside-avoid max-w-3xl page-width-wide:max-w-full page-api-block:ml-0" aria-label="Information" role="note">

<div class="py-4 pl-4 text-info-subtle contrast-more:text-info">

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="gb-icon size-[1.2em] mt-px leading-normal" />

</div>

<div class="p-4 pl-3 empty:p-0 -row-end-1 -col-end-1 space-y-3 [&_.hint]:border [&_pre]:border [&_pre]:border-neutral">

To function properly, the `useSortable` hook needs to be used within a descendant of a <a href="/presets/sortable/sortable-context" class="underline decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100"><code class="sourceCode mandoc">SortableContext</code></a> provider higher up in the tree.

</div>

</div>

## 

<div class="relative hash grid grid-area-1-1 h-[1em] border-0 opacity-0 group-hover/hash:opacity-[0] group-focus/hash:opacity-[0] md:group-hover/hash:opacity-[1] md:group-focus/hash:opacity-[1] -ml-6 pr-2">

<a href="#usage" class="inline-flex h-full items-start leading-tight" aria-label="Direct link to heading"><img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="gb-icon self-center transition-colors text-transparent group-hover/hash:text-tint-subtle contrast-more:group-hover/hash:text-tint-strong size-4" /></a>

</div>

<div class="flex-1 z-1 max-w-full break-words text-start justify-self-start leading-tight">

Usage

</div>

If you're already familiar with the <a href="/api-documentation/draggable" class="underline decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100"><code class="sourceCode mandoc">useDraggable</code></a> hook, the `useSortable` hook should look very familiar, since, it is an abstraction on top of it.

In addition to the `attributes`, `listeners`,`transform` and `setNodeRef` arguments, which you should already be familiar with if you've used the `useDraggable` hook before, you'll notice that the `useSortable` hook also provides a <a href="/presets/sortable/usesortable#transform" class="underline decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100"><code class="sourceCode mandoc">transition</code></a> argument.

<div class="group/codeblock grid shrink grid-flow-col overflow-hidden mx-auto page-width-wide:mx-0 w-full decoration-primary/6 print:break-inside-avoid max-w-3xl page-width-wide:max-w-full page-api-block:ml-0" aria-busy="false">

<div class="flex items-center justify-start gap-2 text-sm [grid-area:1/1]">

</div>

<span class="button-content truncate">Copy</span>

``` relative
import React from 'react';
import {useSortable} from '@dnd-kit/sortable';
import {CSS} from '@dnd-kit/utilities';

function SortableItem(props) {
  const {
    attributes,
    listeners,
    setNodeRef,
    transform,
    transition,
  } = useSortable({id: props.id});
  
  const style = {
    transform: CSS.Transform.toString(transform),
    transition,
  };
  
  return (
    <li ref={setNodeRef} style={style} {...attributes} {...listeners}>
      {/* ... */}
    </li>
  );
}
```

</div>

## 

<div class="relative hash grid grid-area-1-1 h-[1em] border-0 opacity-0 group-hover/hash:opacity-[0] group-focus/hash:opacity-[0] md:group-hover/hash:opacity-[1] md:group-focus/hash:opacity-[1] -ml-6 pr-2">

<a href="#properties" class="inline-flex h-full items-start leading-tight" aria-label="Direct link to heading"><img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="gb-icon self-center transition-colors text-transparent group-hover/hash:text-tint-subtle contrast-more:group-hover/hash:text-tint-strong size-4" /></a>

</div>

<div class="flex-1 z-1 max-w-full break-words text-start justify-self-start leading-tight">

Properties

</div>

### 

<div class="relative hash grid grid-area-1-1 h-[1em] border-0 opacity-0 group-hover/hash:opacity-[0] group-focus/hash:opacity-[0] md:group-hover/hash:opacity-[1] md:group-focus/hash:opacity-[1] -ml-6 pr-2">

<a href="#listeners" class="inline-flex h-full items-start leading-snug" aria-label="Direct link to heading"><img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="gb-icon self-center transition-colors text-transparent group-hover/hash:text-tint-subtle contrast-more:group-hover/hash:text-tint-strong size-4" /></a>

</div>

<div class="flex-1 z-1 max-w-full break-words text-start justify-self-start leading-snug">

Listeners

</div>

The `listeners` property contains the <a href="/api-documentation/sensors#activators" class="underline decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100">activator event handlers</a> for each <a href="/api-documentation/sensors" class="underline decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100">Sensor</a> that is defined on the parent <a href="/api-documentation/context-provider#props" class="underline decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100"><code class="sourceCode mandoc">DndContext</code></a> provider.

It should be attached to the node(s) that you wish to use as the activator to begin a sort event. In most cases, that will be the same node as the one passed to `setNodeRef`, though not necessarily. For instance, when implementing a sortable element with a "drag handle", the ref should be attached to the parent node that should be sortable, but the listeners can be attached to the handle node instead.

For additional details on the <a href="/api-documentation/draggable#listeners" class="underline decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100"><code class="sourceCode mandoc">listeners</code></a> property, refer to the <a href="/api-documentation/draggable" class="underline decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100"><code class="sourceCode mandoc">useDraggable</code></a> documentation.

### 

<div class="relative hash grid grid-area-1-1 h-[1em] border-0 opacity-0 group-hover/hash:opacity-[0] group-focus/hash:opacity-[0] md:group-hover/hash:opacity-[1] md:group-focus/hash:opacity-[1] -ml-6 pr-2">

<a href="#attributes" class="inline-flex h-full items-start leading-snug" aria-label="Direct link to heading"><img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="gb-icon self-center transition-colors text-transparent group-hover/hash:text-tint-subtle contrast-more:group-hover/hash:text-tint-strong size-4" /></a>

</div>

<div class="flex-1 z-1 max-w-full break-words text-start justify-self-start leading-snug">

Attributes

</div>

The `useSortable` hook provides a set of sensible default attributes for draggable items. We recommend you attach these to your draggable elements, though nothing will break if you don't.

For additional details on the <a href="/api-documentation/draggable#attributes" class="underline decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100"><code class="sourceCode mandoc">attributes</code></a> property, refer to the <a href="/api-documentation/draggable" class="underline decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100"><code class="sourceCode mandoc">useDraggable</code></a> documentation.

### 

<div class="relative hash grid grid-area-1-1 h-[1em] border-0 opacity-0 group-hover/hash:opacity-[0] group-focus/hash:opacity-[0] md:group-hover/hash:opacity-[1] md:group-focus/hash:opacity-[1] -ml-6 pr-2">

<a href="#transform" class="inline-flex h-full items-start leading-snug" aria-label="Direct link to heading"><img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="gb-icon self-center transition-colors text-transparent group-hover/hash:text-tint-subtle contrast-more:group-hover/hash:text-tint-strong size-4" /></a>

</div>

<div class="flex-1 z-1 max-w-full break-words text-start justify-self-start leading-snug">

Transform

</div>

The `transform` property represents the displacement and change of scale transformation that a sortable item needs to apply to transition to its new position without needing to update the DOM order.

The `transform` property for the `useSortable` hook behaves similarly to the <a href="/api-documentation/draggable#transforms" class="underline decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100"><code class="sourceCode mandoc">transform</code></a> property of the <a href="/api-documentation/draggable" class="underline decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100"><code class="sourceCode mandoc">useDraggable</code></a> hook for the active sortable item, when there is no <a href="/api-documentation/draggable/drag-overlay" class="underline decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100"><code class="sourceCode mandoc">DragOverlay</code></a> being used.

### 

<div class="relative hash grid grid-area-1-1 h-[1em] border-0 opacity-0 group-hover/hash:opacity-[0] group-focus/hash:opacity-[0] md:group-hover/hash:opacity-[1] md:group-focus/hash:opacity-[1] -ml-6 pr-2">

<a href="#node-ref" class="inline-flex h-full items-start leading-snug" aria-label="Direct link to heading"><img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="gb-icon self-center transition-colors text-transparent group-hover/hash:text-tint-subtle contrast-more:group-hover/hash:text-tint-strong size-4" /></a>

</div>

<div class="flex-1 z-1 max-w-full break-words text-start justify-self-start leading-snug">

Node ref

</div>

In order for the `useSortable` hook to function properly, it needs the `setNodeRef` property to be attached to the HTML element you intend on turning into a sortable element:

<div class="group/codeblock grid shrink grid-flow-col overflow-hidden mx-auto page-width-wide:mx-0 w-full decoration-primary/6 print:break-inside-avoid max-w-3xl page-width-wide:max-w-full page-api-block:ml-0" aria-busy="false">

<div class="flex items-center justify-start gap-2 text-sm [grid-area:1/1]">

</div>

<span class="button-content truncate">Copy</span>

``` relative
function SortableItem(props) {
  const {setNodeRef} = useDraggable({
    id: props.id,
  });
  
  return (
    <li ref={setNodeRef}>
      {/* ... */}
    </li>
  );
}
```

</div>

Keep in mind that the `ref` should be assigned to the outer container that you want to become draggable, but this doesn't necessarily need to coincide with the container that the listeners are attached to:

<div class="group/codeblock grid shrink grid-flow-col overflow-hidden mx-auto page-width-wide:mx-0 w-full decoration-primary/6 print:break-inside-avoid max-w-3xl page-width-wide:max-w-full page-api-block:ml-0" aria-busy="false">

<div class="flex items-center justify-start gap-2 text-sm [grid-area:1/1]">

</div>

<span class="button-content truncate">Copy</span>

``` relative
function SortableItem(props) {
  const {arguments, listeners, setNodeRef} = useDraggable({
    id: props.id,
  });
  
  return (
    <li ref={setNodeRef}>
      {/* ... */}
      <button {...listeners} {...arguments}>Drag handle</button>
    </li>
  );
}
```

</div>

Since the `useSortable` hook is simply an abstraction on top of the <a href="/api-documentation/draggable/usedraggable" class="underline decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100"><code class="sourceCode mandoc">useDraggable</code></a> and <a href="/api-documentation/droppable/usedroppable" class="underline decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100"><code class="sourceCode mandoc">useDroppable</code></a> hooks, in some advanced use cases, you may also use the `setDroppableNodeRef` and `setDraggableNodeRef` properties to connect them to different nodes. For example, if you want the draggable element to have a different dimension than the droppable element that will be sortable:

<div class="group/codeblock grid shrink grid-flow-col overflow-hidden mx-auto page-width-wide:mx-0 w-full decoration-primary/6 print:break-inside-avoid max-w-3xl page-width-wide:max-w-full page-api-block:ml-0" aria-busy="false">

<div class="flex items-center justify-start gap-2 text-sm [grid-area:1/1]">

</div>

<span class="button-content truncate">Copy</span>

``` relative
function SortableItem(props) {
  const {setDraggableNodeRef, setDroppableNodeRef} = useDraggable({
    id: props.id,
  });
  
  return (
    <li ref={setDroppableNodeRef}>
      {/* ... */}
      <button ref={setDraggableNodeRef}>Drag me</button>
    </li>
  );
}
```

</div>

### 

<div class="relative hash grid grid-area-1-1 h-[1em] border-0 opacity-0 group-hover/hash:opacity-[0] group-focus/hash:opacity-[0] md:group-hover/hash:opacity-[1] md:group-focus/hash:opacity-[1] -ml-6 pr-2">

<a href="#activator" class="inline-flex h-full items-start leading-snug" aria-label="Direct link to heading"><img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="gb-icon self-center transition-colors text-transparent group-hover/hash:text-tint-subtle contrast-more:group-hover/hash:text-tint-strong size-4" /></a>

</div>

<div class="flex-1 z-1 max-w-full break-words text-start justify-self-start leading-snug">

Activator

</div>

**`setActivatorNodeRef`**

It's possible for the listeners to be attached to a different node than the one that `setNodeRef` is attached to.

A common example of this is when implementing a drag handle and attaching the listeners to the drag handle:

<div class="group/codeblock grid shrink grid-flow-col overflow-hidden mx-auto page-width-wide:mx-0 w-full decoration-primary/6 print:break-inside-avoid max-w-3xl page-width-wide:max-w-full page-api-block:ml-0" aria-busy="false">

<div class="flex items-center justify-start gap-2 text-sm [grid-area:1/1]">

</div>

<span class="button-content truncate">Copy</span>

``` relative
function SortableItem(props) {
  const {listeners, setNodeRef} = useSortable({
    id: props.id,
  });
  
  return (
    <li ref={setNodeRef}>
      {/* ... */}
      <button {...listeners}>Drag handle</button>
    </li>
  );
}
```

</div>

When the activator node differs from the draggable node, we recommend setting the activator node ref on the activator node:

<div class="group/codeblock grid shrink grid-flow-col overflow-hidden mx-auto page-width-wide:mx-0 w-full decoration-primary/6 print:break-inside-avoid max-w-3xl page-width-wide:max-w-full page-api-block:ml-0" aria-busy="false">

<div class="flex items-center justify-start gap-2 text-sm [grid-area:1/1]">

</div>

<span class="button-content truncate">Copy</span>

``` relative
function SortableItem(props) {
  const {listeners, setNodeRef, setActivatorNodeRef} = useSortable({
    id: props.id,
  });
  
  return (
    <li ref={setNodeRef}>
      {/* ... */}
      <button ref={setActivatorNodeRef} {...listeners}>Drag handle</button>
    </li>
  );
}
```

</div>

This helps @dnd-kit more accurately handle automatic focus management and can also be accessed by sensors for enhanced activation constraints.

<div class="hint transition-colors rounded-md straight-corners:rounded-none circular-corners:rounded-xl overflow-hidden bg-info border-info theme-muted-tint:bg-info-solid/2 [html.sidebar-filled.theme-bold.tint_&]:bg-info-solid/2 text-sm grid grid-cols-[auto_1fr] mx-auto page-width-wide:mx-0 w-full decoration-primary/6 print:break-inside-avoid max-w-3xl page-width-wide:max-w-full page-api-block:ml-0" aria-label="Information" role="note">

<div class="py-4 pl-4 text-info-subtle contrast-more:text-info">

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="gb-icon size-[1.2em] mt-px leading-normal" />

</div>

<div class="p-4 pl-3 empty:p-0 -row-end-1 -col-end-1 space-y-3 [&_.hint]:border [&_pre]:border [&_pre]:border-neutral">

Focus management is automatically handled by <a href="https://github.com/dnd-kit" class="underline decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100">@dnd-kit<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="gb-icon ml-0.5 inline size-3 links-accent:text-tint-subtle" /></a>. When the activator event is a Keyboard event, focus will automatically be restored back to the first focusable node of the activator node.

If no activator node is set via `setActivatorNodeRef`, focus will automatically be restored on the first focusable node of the draggable node registered via `setNodeRef.`

</div>

</div>

### 

<div class="relative hash grid grid-area-1-1 h-[1em] border-0 opacity-0 group-hover/hash:opacity-[0] group-focus/hash:opacity-[0] md:group-hover/hash:opacity-[1] md:group-focus/hash:opacity-[1] -ml-6 pr-2">

<a href="#transition" class="inline-flex h-full items-start leading-snug" aria-label="Direct link to heading"><img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="gb-icon self-center transition-colors text-transparent group-hover/hash:text-tint-subtle contrast-more:group-hover/hash:text-tint-strong size-4" /></a>

</div>

<div class="flex-1 z-1 max-w-full break-words text-start justify-self-start leading-snug">

Transition

</div>

Refer to the <a href="/presets/sortable/usesortable#transition-1" class="underline decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100"><code class="sourceCode mandoc">transition</code> argument</a> documentation below.

## 

<div class="relative hash grid grid-area-1-1 h-[1em] border-0 opacity-0 group-hover/hash:opacity-[0] group-focus/hash:opacity-[0] md:group-hover/hash:opacity-[1] md:group-focus/hash:opacity-[1] -ml-6 pr-2">

<a href="#arguments" class="inline-flex h-full items-start leading-tight" aria-label="Direct link to heading"><img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="gb-icon self-center transition-colors text-transparent group-hover/hash:text-tint-subtle contrast-more:group-hover/hash:text-tint-strong size-4" /></a>

</div>

<div class="flex-1 z-1 max-w-full break-words text-start justify-self-start leading-tight">

Arguments

</div>

### 

<div class="relative hash grid grid-area-1-1 h-[1em] border-0 opacity-0 group-hover/hash:opacity-[0] group-focus/hash:opacity-[0] md:group-hover/hash:opacity-[1] md:group-focus/hash:opacity-[1] -ml-6 pr-2">

<a href="#identifier" class="inline-flex h-full items-start leading-snug" aria-label="Direct link to heading"><img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="gb-icon self-center transition-colors text-transparent group-hover/hash:text-tint-subtle contrast-more:group-hover/hash:text-tint-strong size-4" /></a>

</div>

<div class="flex-1 z-1 max-w-full break-words text-start justify-self-start leading-snug">

Identifier

</div>

The `id` argument is a `string` or `number` that should be unique.

Since the `useSortable` is an abstraction on top of the `useDroppable` and `useDraggable` hooks, which both require a unique identifier, the `useSortable` hook also requires a unique identifier.

The argument passed to the `id` argument of `useSortable` should match the `id` passed in the `items` array of the parent <a href="/presets/sortable/sortable-context" class="underline decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100"><code class="sourceCode mandoc">SortableContext</code></a> provider.

### 

<div class="relative hash grid grid-area-1-1 h-[1em] border-0 opacity-0 group-hover/hash:opacity-[0] group-focus/hash:opacity-[0] md:group-hover/hash:opacity-[1] md:group-focus/hash:opacity-[1] -ml-6 pr-2">

<a href="#disabled" class="inline-flex h-full items-start leading-snug" aria-label="Direct link to heading"><img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="gb-icon self-center transition-colors text-transparent group-hover/hash:text-tint-subtle contrast-more:group-hover/hash:text-tint-strong size-4" /></a>

</div>

<div class="flex-1 z-1 max-w-full break-words text-start justify-self-start leading-snug">

Disabled

</div>

If you'd like to temporarily disable a sortable item from being interactive, set the `disabled` argument to `true`.

### 

<div class="relative hash grid grid-area-1-1 h-[1em] border-0 opacity-0 group-hover/hash:opacity-[0] group-focus/hash:opacity-[0] md:group-hover/hash:opacity-[1] md:group-focus/hash:opacity-[1] -ml-6 pr-2">

<a href="#transition-1" class="inline-flex h-full items-start leading-snug" aria-label="Direct link to heading"><img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="gb-icon self-center transition-colors text-transparent group-hover/hash:text-tint-subtle contrast-more:group-hover/hash:text-tint-strong size-4" /></a>

</div>

<div class="flex-1 z-1 max-w-full break-words text-start justify-self-start leading-snug">

Transition

</div>

The transition argument controls the value of the `transition` property for you. It conveniently disables transform transitions while not dragging, but ensures that items transition back to their final positions when the drag operation is ended or cancelled.

It also disables transitions for the active sortable element that is being dragged, unless there is a <a href="/api-documentation/draggable/drag-overlay" class="underline decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100"><code class="sourceCode mandoc">DragOverlay</code></a> being used.

The default transition is `250` milliseconds, with an easing function set to `ease`, but you can customize this and pass any valid <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transition-timing-function" class="underline decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100">CSS transition timing function<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="gb-icon ml-0.5 inline size-3 links-accent:text-tint-subtle" /></a>.

<div class="group/codeblock grid shrink grid-flow-col overflow-hidden mx-auto page-width-wide:mx-0 w-full decoration-primary/6 print:break-inside-avoid max-w-3xl page-width-wide:max-w-full page-api-block:ml-0" aria-busy="false">

<div class="flex items-center justify-start gap-2 text-sm [grid-area:1/1]">

</div>

<span class="button-content truncate">Copy</span>

``` relative
const {
  transition,
} = useSortable({
  transition: {
    duration: 150, // milliseconds
    easing: 'cubic-bezier(0.25, 1, 0.5, 1)',
  },
});
```

</div>

Make sure you pass the `transition` style property to the same node that has the `transform` property applied:

<div class="group/codeblock grid shrink grid-flow-col overflow-hidden mx-auto page-width-wide:mx-0 w-full decoration-primary/6 print:break-inside-avoid max-w-3xl page-width-wide:max-w-full page-api-block:ml-0" aria-busy="false">

<div class="flex items-center justify-start gap-2 text-sm [grid-area:1/1]">

</div>

<span class="button-content truncate">Copy</span>

``` relative
import React from 'react';
import {useSortable} from '@dnd-kit/sortable';
import {CSS} from '@dnd-kit/utilities';

function SortableItem(props) {
  const {
    transform,
    transition,
  } = useSortable({id: props.id});
  
  const style = {
    transform: CSS.Transform.toString(transform),
    transition,
  };
  
  return (
    <li style={style}>
      {/* ... */}
    </li>
  );
}
```

</div>

If you prefer, you may also use CSS variables to manage the `transform` and `transition` properties:

<div class="group/codeblock grid shrink grid-flow-col overflow-hidden mx-auto page-width-wide:mx-0 w-full decoration-primary/6 print:break-inside-avoid max-w-3xl page-width-wide:max-w-full page-api-block:ml-0" aria-busy="false">

<div class="flex items-center justify-start gap-2 text-sm [grid-area:1/1]">

</div>

<span class="button-content truncate">Copy</span>

``` relative
import React from 'react';
import {useSortable} from '@dnd-kit/sortable';
import {CSS} from '@dnd-kit/utilities';

function SortableItem(props) {
  const {
    transform,
    transition,
  } = useSortable({id: props.id});
  
  const style = {
    '--translate-x': transform ? transform.x : 0,
    '--translate-y': transform ? transform.y : 0,
    '--transition': transition,
  };
  
  return (
    <li style={style}>
      {/* ... */}
    </li>
  );
}
```

</div>

To disable transitions entirely, set the `transition` argument to `null`:

<div class="group/codeblock grid shrink grid-flow-col overflow-hidden mx-auto page-width-wide:mx-0 w-full decoration-primary/6 print:break-inside-avoid max-w-3xl page-width-wide:max-w-full page-api-block:ml-0" aria-busy="false">

<div class="flex items-center justify-start gap-2 text-sm [grid-area:1/1]">

</div>

<span class="button-content truncate">Copy</span>

``` relative
const {
  transition,
} = useSortable({
  transition: null,
});
```

</div>

If you prefer to manage transitions yourself, you may also choose to do so, but this isn't something we recommend.

### 

<div class="relative hash grid grid-area-1-1 h-[1em] border-0 opacity-0 group-hover/hash:opacity-[0] group-focus/hash:opacity-[0] md:group-hover/hash:opacity-[1] md:group-focus/hash:opacity-[1] -ml-6 pr-2">

<a href="#sorting-strategy" class="inline-flex h-full items-start leading-snug" aria-label="Direct link to heading"><img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="gb-icon self-center transition-colors text-transparent group-hover/hash:text-tint-subtle contrast-more:group-hover/hash:text-tint-strong size-4" /></a>

</div>

<div class="flex-1 z-1 max-w-full break-words text-start justify-self-start leading-snug">

Sorting strategy

</div>

Optionally, you can pass a local sorting strategy that differs from the <a href="/presets/sortable/sortable-context#strategy" class="underline decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100">global sorting strategy</a> passed to the parent `SortableContext` provider.

</div>

<div class="mx-auto mt-6 page-api-block:ml-0 flex max-w-3xl page-full-width:max-w-screen-2xl flex-row flex-wrap items-center gap-4 text-tint contrast-more:text-tint-strong">

</div>
